Reviews.Title: A comment about sound quality
Reviews.Author: Winman97
Reviews.Content: I own this 40" 78 series Sharp Aquos TV.  First said, The  picture quality is outstanding, and can be tweaked to an infinite level with all the in depth menu settings. The speakers are on the bottom and fire downward.  I find the sound to be very good on all inputs EXCEPT for TV where you are pulling your signal thru a coax cable.  For whatever reason sound level is way down on that input.  But on HDMI, component, etc sound level is strong and actually sounds pretty good. But to note, this weak sound on the TV input seems to be the norm, as I have noticed that effect on my other non Sharp flat screen TVs as well. I have my Sharp TV sitting in an entertainment center, so that serves as an amplifing box and pushes the sounds out in a good strong level. One GREAT thing about this (and most Sharp TVs) is that they have the RCA audio output jacks that can be connected to the older style receivers that do not have the optical input.I just plug my red/white audio cable jacks from the TV to  the matching input jacks on my receiver and like magic, there is great sound being delivered through my stereo system.  You don't even have to turn the TV's speakers off, as the output jacks carry the signal along with the TV's internal speakers.  You can turn the TV speaker volume down to zero without effecting the stereo's sound level, or you can turn the TV's speaker volume up slightly and get a really cool surround type effect.All in all I love this TV and it's quality features. Sharp is one of the leading LCD screen manufacturers in the world, and they usually lead the industry in quality and innovation (Such as the Sharp Quattron screen with the extra "yellow" pixel.)Sharp has always made great electronics.  I currenty have a 30 year old Sharp 13" TV (with remote control) set up in our kitchen and it still performs as well today as it did 30 years ago when it was new.

Reviews.Title: Great 1st HD TV
Reviews.Author: Blue Eyed Love Goddess "BELGM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our 1st HD tv, for our living room.  It is of course not as good as a $1,000 TV but I could not afford that price.  I was concerned with the speaker issue several people discussed on thier reviews...BUT there is NO issue....the sound is great and I usually only have it at about 15.  No need for a bigger speaker.  ALSO someone complained it did not come wiht a manual...but it does, and even if they did not have one you can get it online to download.  Additionally, I was a little confused in the set-up but that was due to the cable box not the tv. All in all...we love this tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Sharp AQUOS LC40D78UN
Reviews.Author: Daniel E Kelley
Reviews.Content: We purchased this television about a month ago and so far we're very happy with its picture and performance.  We did pay considerably less buying it locally (just under $600).Unlike another comment, I had no problem with the remote control, though since adding a satellite receiver to the television, I find myself rarely using the TV remote. The HD picture is just fantastic and even SD television is a far improvement over our previous CRT SD television.My only criticism of the unit is the sound, which appears to be directed toward the rear of the unit.  As we've got it sitting in an enclosed cabinet, it took a little getting used to, but is no longer an issue.For the price we paid, this was an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Kentkatchem
Reviews.Content: I got this TV about 3 weeks ago, and I have to say I just LOVE IT!!!  I couldn't be happier w/the choice I made. I had a Sharp Aquos before, a 32 inch that just started giving out. I guess they don't last forever, but other than that I've really enjoyed my experience w/Sharp. I bought this Sharp for 499.99 (which to me was a steal for a 40in) but I also got FREE 2 day delivery! I was just amazed that I was able to buy this Wednesday afternoon, & have it in my room & hooked up by Friday night. Awsome!!!! The picture looks great, I love all the HDMI ports it has to offer... & for me, I'm still old school when it comes to a surround sound receiver so I needed the RA jacks, which most new TV's do not offer, but Sharp does! I also have this hooked up to my Xbox360 & my PS3...I just couldn't get over how CLEAR the picture is! It truly is a 1080p, my first one by the way..& it does not dissapoint. About the only thing that I would say is a bit of a negative (small one at that) is the speakers on the TV are facing down. So the sound would be a little muffled if your not used to it..but I use my surround sound anyhow, so no biggie there. I have not tried to hook up my computer to it yet but from what I've heard,that looks amazing too. Just some final thoughts, I just LOVE how this looks in my room..it barely fit in my entertainment center but I got it in..& now it's just like having a personal Movie theater in my room...PS3 looks Fantastic on here..I get on "Home" sometimes just to stare at the clarity of the picture..lol..Oh , and watching Blu-Ray movies on here.. Fantastic! I so wish I would've bought this earlier, it's by far my fav. piece of furniture now.. lol. And by the way, Amazon rocks!!!! I normally would've bought  something of this size from Newegg in the past, but after this experience with Amazon, I'm a believer, I will buy all my future merchandise from them. Thanks again Amazon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous TV
Reviews.Author: rbgiantfan
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 3 weeks so I figured it was safe to write a review. I have not gotten into the most intricate features of this unit but I have gone through the basics.  First and foremost the picture is outstanding.  It is everything I hoped HDTV would be.  The 120hz scan rate makes the action crystal clear.  I never owned a 60hz so I can't compare it - I'll just say the picture is awesome, with no artifacts, blur, distortion of any kind.  The colors are gorgeous.  I can't imagine a picture being any better than this.  The cabinetry is also very attractive and stylish.  The bezel is quite narrow and the stand is unobtrusive.  I had to fit this TV into an old entertainment armoire that was only 39" wide.  Many 40" TV's can't fit, this one can (albeit snugly).The package arrived in NY about one week from order date.  [...], no tax, free shipping for a 40" 120hz 1080p LCD.  You simply can't find a better deal.  I was concerned that I couldn't find many reviews on this set.  That is why I am taking the time to write this one.  Buy this TV and enjoy it.  I sure am!

Reviews.Title: Great for Console Gaming!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Clapper
Reviews.Content: I recently picked up this TV [Sharp AQUOS LC40D78UN] from a fantastic Seller here on Amazon, and couldn't be happier. I had been pulling my hair out over the last few months looking for a TV to play my XBOX360 and PS3 on, looking at reviews it seems the new 240hz 3D tvs are terrible for gaming because of input lag [nothing to do with internet lag] do a little research and you'll see what I mean. Anyways, after looking and looking I came across some reviews and test results showing this TV to have very low lag, an excellent picture quality, and a blazing refresh rate. This TV delivers on all levels. I borrowed some settings from an AV forum and tweaked them a bit till they look great for my room and setup.Some reviewers complain about the sound quality off of the TV speakers, but I could care less about this, as I have everything routed through an awesome SONY receiver.Overall this is a great TV. It replaced a Vizio 32 plasma that was not suited for heavy gaming because of image retention [gets to be annoying quickly]. It has plenty of HDMI inputs for both my consoles and HD Cable. I've watched a couple blu ray movies and they look crystal clear even in fast motion scenes. I am very pleased with black levels, no complaints at all.  Since this set is a full backlit and not an edgelit like most of the new TVs being made now I have noticed no banding, ghosting, or halo effects on anything I've watched yet.Again, I love this TV, and any hardcore gamers out there will too.

Reviews.Title: Sounds hardly there
Reviews.Author: Stock Trader "Globeseller"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Sharp 3 days ago. The TV is plug in to a coaxial cable via a charter TV.The picture is bright and comparable to a SONY 120 hertz. A Tad cleaner and better but a TAD less color than a SONY. I have both so I did a comparison.The Sharp sound is really a dissapointment. I have the TV at 60 volume level and still the sound is soft.(max is at 60 too) Plug it to a Blue ray player and the sound is still nochalant. Very soft and you could ever hardly hear all the sound and what more if you turn on the surround. I have a very quiet house. I compared it to my Hitachi 40 inch too and the Hitachi volume level is only at 20 and yet its loud. Max volume setting on Hitachi is 50.I short, the picture is great and judder free. Color is superb close to a SONY but more better than a Hitachi. But the sound is less than a SONY and much lesser than a Hitachi.If you plug the RCA output sound to an amplifier then you'll have a much better sound experience.

Reviews.Title: Sharp AQUOS LC40D78UN 40-Inch 1080p LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Rev
Reviews.Content: Purchased from Luzy's Storage Place. The tv is very nice. I have always been a fan of Sharp's Aquos technology for the crispness and clarity of the picture being displayed. Though it is an older model its still very good compared with other brand name tvs in the market. So far no problems with the tv after 2 years.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tv!
Reviews.Author: Hippie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Tv for the pricepoint! These days its so hard to actually find a Tv,It's down right Stressful! I had a Vizio in our family room that died 3 DAYS after the extended warranty! Doesn't that just piss you off?? Any way my other 2 Vizio have had no problems so with that in mind I started looking for something different that wouldn't break the Bank this was a good choice we don't have a huge room for the Monster Flat screen! This tv has a great picture lots of features and i've had no issues or complaints! Best of all my Wife hasn't had any Problems! Happy Wife Happy Life!! No Offense to any wives!! I mean that in a good way. My wife is the one who uses this tv the most and she was really happy that I replaced the old tv with a Bigger one. Plus the picture is much nicer. Very vibrant and the OPC ( Optical Picture Control) Is a great feature! Any time the light in the room changes it automatically changes the picture so its easier to view!! Like I said no problems or complaints if that changes I will update this post.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Micheal
Reviews.Content: We received our tv and set it up. It works great and was easy to set up. The picture is extremely clear and the sound is great.

Reviews.Title: Love it, Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I love this TV, have had it for about a year.  Awesome price, great picture, very clear and bright, absolutely no problems with this TV whatsoever.  PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: outstanding purchase
Reviews.Author: Frankie
Reviews.Content: I love this Sharp tv for the guest room .  I already have a sharp sound bar and that just enhances the entire experience since the room is too small for a surround sound system. It took 2 phone calls to sharp to get it all set up but now it is working fine and all my guests love having a flat screen tv in their room when they just wanna relax in bed

Reviews.Title: Excellent value LCD
Reviews.Author: Mr. Paul Hill
Reviews.Content: I just bought this very model brand new for an amazing $470 from costco, yes the sound is a bit weird and weak,i was playing movies at maximum volume 60, but at this price for an full HD 40" 1080P 120Hz!!  which is awesome for fast moving live sports etc, this is a steal for a well known and respected brand, time to spend some money on some nice speakers to pair up with it, can not fault it for this price.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Aquos 40-inch 1080p LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything it was said to be.  Fantastic picture and features.  This is my second Sharp Aquos, they are FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: T. Wade
Reviews.Content: great for gaming cuz of vyperdrive, great picture with superb brightness.  Sharp customer service is also very helpful.  Only thing that is a con is that it is hard to notice the 120hz because this doesn't give you the over-processed soap opera effect.

Reviews.Title: great, but some quirks
Reviews.Author: Gerard Garcia
Reviews.Content: So far so good. This is our first HDTV and we reluctantly replaced our 27" Sony WEGA CRT because we received this Sharp Aquos as a present.What can I say - HD is the bee's knees and so far, this display has delivered.To my eyes, every display starts to look the same after a certain size, so no input there.This display does have a few quirks, but I believe it's not the fault of the display. Here they are:1. No closed-captioning via HDMI. Again, it's not the fault of the display and probably irrelevant in this review, but we had to enable closed-captioning using our satellite receiver.2. The power-saving options are great, but they'll work even when you don't want them to. My advice - just turn it off when you're not using it.So, I give this display 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Samsung
Reviews.Author: Jim Cye
Reviews.Content: I have an older 50" samsung (4 years old) that outperforms this 40" Sharp LCD. Unlike the name implies, the picture is not really very sharpe. However, at $549 for a 40" Sharp LCD/1080p/120hz, the price justifies the negatives. Fortunately, it is used in a dark corner of my bedroom (not my main tv); thus, it is sufficient for years to follow. It's just missing any WOW factor when watching HD channels; while my older Samsung produces some of that WOW factor (bright/sharpe/crisp/true skin coloration)& clarity.Jim

Reviews.Title: Sharp AQUOS 40 inch LCD
Reviews.Author: ReviewIt
Reviews.Content: When set next to a 3 year old 40" Samsung LCD on the same channel, it doesn't come close to comparing - it almost looks like HD vs non-HD.  While the HD picture is sharp, the screen is about half as bright as the Samsung.  I have played with all of the settings and it doesn't come close.  Definitely disappointed, but maybe I'm just spoiled with the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: It's just ok
Reviews.Author: Goldie
Reviews.Content: 1. No manual for this tv. It's really needed.2. The audio is too weak. It is set to deliver sound toward the back (wall) of the set so you must increse the level to hear properly.3. The remote control is not intuitive. You either experiment and learn the hard way or call SHARP.4. There is no way to know if you are watching 1080 or 720. The only way of knowing is to buy a BLU RAY player with a really good disc and play it back into the TV.5. This is my first flat panel TV and I am not too satisfied with it as you can see from the above.6. I now have it for three weeks.
